title: 103_hr3810
content: The Act may be cited as the "Rural Community Wastewater Treatment Affordability Act of 1994". Eligibility criteria are outlined in the Act. The Rural Community Wastewater Treatment Affordability Act of 1994 outlines eligibility criteria for acquiring lands, easements, and rights-of-ways necessary for construction of treatment works. It also includes provisions for rural nonprofit water associations to provide wastewater treatment and water supply services to communities. It also includes provisions for rural nonprofit water associations to provide wastewater treatment and water supply services to communities. Section 602(b) of the Federal Water Pollution Control Act is amended to encourage the use of innovative and cost-effective technologies in the construction of treatment works financed with assistance provided from the fund. The Loan Program under the Federal Water Pollution Control Act is amended to provide loans to rural and disadvantaged communities at or below market interest rates, including interest-free and negative-interest loans, with terms not exceeding 40 years or the useful life of the project. The Loan Program under the Federal Water Pollution Control Act is amended to provide loans to rural and disadvantaged communities at terms not to exceed 40 years or the useful life of the project being financed. Additionally, not more than 15 percent of all loans made from the water pollution control revolving fund will be allocated after the enactment of this amendment. The Loan Program under the Federal Water Pollution Control Act is amended to provide loans to rural and disadvantaged communities. Grants will also be made to these communities to cover planning and predevelopment costs. The Federal Water Pollution Control Act is amended to provide loans and grants to rural and disadvantaged communities for planning and predevelopment costs related to construction or improvement of treatment works. Grants shall not exceed 2 percent of Federal grant awards and $75,000 per project. The Federal Water Pollution Control Act is amended to provide loans and grants to rural and disadvantaged communities for planning and predevelopment costs related to construction or improvement of treatment works. A new subsection defines "rural and disadvantaged communities" as service areas of publicly owned treatment works with a population of less than 10,000 and residents with a median household income below 75 percent of the national median. The Federal Water Pollution Control Act is amended to provide loans and grants to rural and disadvantaged communities for planning and predevelopment costs related to construction or improvement of treatment works. A negative-interest loan is defined as a loan with zero percent interest rate and forgiveness of up to 20 percent of the principal over the term of the loan. The Federal Water Pollution Control Act is amended to limit administrative costs to 4 percent of total funds deposited in a fiscal year. Additionally, a technical assistance grant program is established under Title VI of the Act. The Administrator may grant funds to organizations for training and assistance in rural communities for treatment works. $15,000,000 per fiscal year is authorized for this purpose until 1998. A conforming amendment is made to Section 607 of the Act. Section 607 of the Act (33 U.S.C. 1387) is amended to exclude section 608.
